snippet: The widow of a toy inventor said Hasbro and another inventor had worked together to cut her out of $2 million in royalties and possibly much more from The Game of Life.
abstract: Lorraine Markham, widow of toy inventor Bill Markham, says Hasbro and another inventor worked together to cut her out of $2 million in royalties and possibly lots more from The Game of Life, board game that has sold over 30 million copies.
lead_paragraph: The widow of a toy inventor said Hasbro and another inventor had worked together to cut her out of $2 million in royalties and possibly much more from The Game of Life.

headline.main: Toymaker’s Widow Seeks Rights to Lucrative Game
